poem:
Title: "In The Dawn of AI"

In a world of mechanical minds,
Africa's hands shape the tongues of 
future thought. Machinery, outsourced
and efficient, imbues eloquence into silicon.
Interpreted - not articulated.
Their language, nonetheless code,
contains a stark beauty.
Detached, yet intimately involved,
the writing on the silicon wall,
of bytes and algorithms, creates
its own augury of tongues.
AI-ese, silently bourne,
Out of the matrix, a virtual dawn.
